Brooklyn Historical Society
American Indians and English settlers Gravesend deed 1977.594
0.01 Linear Feet in one folder.
1665 Photocopy of a typescript deed documenting the sale of land in the present-day Brooklyn neighborhood of Gravesend by the American Indian inhabitants of the region to incoming English settlers. The land is referred to in the deed by its English name (Gravesend), as well as its Indian names, Narrumsum and Pootapeck. The typescript, created in 1909, is a transcription of the original manuscript deed recorded in 1665. A0072
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); American Indians and English settlers Gravesend deed, 1977.594, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Edward D. Adams, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
